Context:
There are several external awards and scholarships available for students based on specific demographics and eligibility requirements. Here are some examples:

1. A bursary worth CA$2,000 is awarded annually to two female candidates living with epilepsy to further their education or career. (ELIGIBILITY: Female candidates living with epilepsy)
2. The B. Harper Bull Scholarship Awards provide scholarships valued at CA$4,000 each to students pursuing a future career in the environmental or cultural heritage sectors. (ELIGIBILITY: Students pursuing a future career in the environmental or cultural heritage sectors)
3. The Barbados Canada Foundation offers 91 scholarships valued at CA$286,000 in total to Barbadian youth pursuing post-secondary education in Canadian universities and colleges. (ELIGIBILITY: Youth of Barbadian heritage)
4. Scholarships worth CA$4,000 each are available for students who identify as part of the LGBTTTQ community, who are in financial need, and who are Ontario residents. (ELIGIBILITY: Students who identify as part of the LGBTTTQ community, who are in financial need, and who are Ontario residents)
5. Scholarships worth CA$4,000 each are awarded to aboriginal students in full-time post-secondary studies who took at least 12 months off from education prior to returning (mature students) and who have completed at least one academic year of a multi-year program. (ELIGIBILITY: Aboriginal students who took at least 12 months off from education prior to returning to full-time post-secondary studies and who have completed at least one academic year of a multi-year program)
6. 176 scholarships worth CA$25,000 each will be awarded over five years to college and university students in honor of the victims of the PS752 flight disaster. (ELIGIBILITY: Canadian and international college and university students)

APPLICATION DEADLINE: June 16, 2023
WEBSITE: Barbados Canada Foundation website
EMAIL: N/A
CONTACT INFORMATION: N/A
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/External Awards, Scholarships & Bursaries | George Brown College.txt

Context:
The Flight PS752 Commemorative Scholarship Program is open for academic year 2023-2024. Scholarships worth an average of $25,000 will be granted. A minimum of 70% of the scholarships are reserved for international students. Family members of victims of flight PS752 will be prioritized. Applicants need to provide reasons for applying, their understanding and awareness of the tragedy, connections with the victims, and plans on how to honor their legacies. Application deadline is October 31, 2023.

Eligible applicants are Canadian Forces members, their dependents, or students living in a CHFT member cooperative entering their first year of college based on financial need and positive contributions. Scholarships may also be awarded to full-time hard-of-hearing or deafened students, students demonstrating financial need and potential to succeed, and permanent residents of Bruce or Grey County showing commitment to stronger communities.

The CICan Paul and Gerri Charette Bursary Program offers financial support to post-secondary students who demonstrate financial need and face challenges in participating and completing their education. Eligibility requires that the student has not attended a post-secondary institution before.

For more information on various scholarships, please visit international.gc.ca or clwalkerton.org.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/External Awards, Scholarships & Bursaries | George Brown College.txt

   - Notice of Award: March 15, 2024

Context:
The Sun Life scholarship and internship program has the following requirements:

1. Students can apply by submitting an online application which includes a 500-word personal essay or a 3-5 minute video essay, a one page resume, and unofficial transcripts of academic records.
2. The application deadline is November 17th, 2023 at 1:00 PM EST.
3. Applicants will be notified if they were successful or not after the applications are reviewed and assessed.
4. Applicants should add awards@univcan.ca to their safe senders in their junk email options to continue receiving important messages from SPC.
5. Supporting documentation, including documents that are missing or incomplete, must be received by SPC on or before November 17th, 2023 at 1:00 PM EST for an application to be considered.
6. The application process is managed online.

The text provides information about various scholarships offered by TD and WE Care Canada for students in Canada. Here's the factual information extracted from the text:

1. Application deadline for the Indigenous Student Scholarships is November 17, 2023, by 1:00 PM EST.
2. The Indigenous Student Scholarships have the following criteria: open to students in their final year of high school or CEGEP in Canada, minimum overall grade average of 75% in their most recently completed school year, and demonstrated community leadership. TD Scholarship for Indigenous Peoples will help recipients with tuition, living expenses, and exploring employment opportunities at TD. Students must apply online through the website: Indigenous Student Scholarships Grants And Bursaries (td.com).
3. The Terry Fox Humanitarian Award recognizes humanitarian volunteer work, and students can apply until November 6, 2023. There is no set discipline for students to study.
4. The Kevin Collins Abilities Scholarship is worth $3,000 and is awarded at the annual gala in the fall. Eligible applicants must have at least one full semester left in their post-secondary education. Students must send their application package to info@wecare-canada.org with the subject line ‘SCHOLARSHIP’ by March 31, 2023.
5. The R. Samuel McNaughton Scholarship is granted for outstanding post-secondary achievement by black students in Ontario.

Context:
The American Hat Makers scholarship is a hat design contest for aspiring fashion designers and students in the clothing/garment industry. The contest offers three places: 1st Place wins $500 cash prize, featured showcase of the design on their website and social media platforms, and a certificate of achievement; 2nd Place wins $300 cash prize, recognition on their website and social media platforms, and a certificate of achievement; and 3rd Place wins $200 cash prize, mention on their website and social media platforms, and a certificate of achievement. The important dates for the contest are not specified in the text. For more information, please visit the American Hat Makers' site.

The Salt Spring National Art Prize (SSNAP) is a not-for-profit organization that recognizes, showcases, and advances the accomplishments of Canadian visual artists. SSNAP offers $50,000 in awards, and the deadline date for submissions is May 31, 2023. For more information, please visit the SSNAP website.

Allied Van Lines Scholarship is awarded to a Canadian citizen or Permanent Resident enrolled in a full-time post-secondary institution in a Logistics or equivalent field. The applicant must submit a brief essay of 400 to 800 words detailing why logistics/supply chain management is important.

The Corporate Finance Institute Annual Scholarship is for both part-time and full-time students who show passion for finance and can demonstrate their determination to improve lives through their careers, as well as someone who shows financial need so that they can attend post-secondary institutions.

The Estey Undergraduate Student Essay Competition is awarded based on a research paper on business or accounting/finance or related topics. Students can resubmit papers from the previous year, but all work must represent students' independent and individual work. No specific information about the deadline date for submissions was provided in the text.

RBC (no specific information was provided in the text related to RBC's programs or scholarships).
